Abstract: Pedro Hernandez’s history of psychiatric diagnoses could weigh on the credibility of his three-and-a-half-hour confession.
Snippet: Pedro Hernandez’s history of psychiatric diagnoses could weigh on the credibility of his three-and-a-half-hour confession.
LeadParagraph: Pedro Hernandez, the man the authorities say has confessed to killing Etan Patz in a Manhattan bodega 33 years ago, has been prescribed at least one antipsychotic medication for “a number of years,” a person with knowledge of his mental history said on Saturday.

Headline.Main: Suspect’s Mental History Emerges in Etan Patz Case
Headline.PrintHeadline: Suspect’s Mental History Emerges in Patz Case

Byline.Original: By Al Baker and Joseph Goldstein
